page.title: 07Footpaths Around Stoulton
page.content: The footpaths on our walk were poorly marked, most of them were overgrown with weeds and obscured by farmers' crops which made them impassable. Many paths and bridle ways which were shown on the Ordnance Survey Maps did not exist. The footpaths were not properly made - they were just dirt tracks, muddy, rough and hard to walk along. Constant care was needed to avoid ditches, holes and thistles. As we surveyed each plot, we found that we were becoming lost because paths on our map existed no longer in reality. Those that did exist were in desperate need of repair. The County Council now has a priority system for re-opening and maintaining the more essential footpaths.
